intro: Alsodeia sessilis, commonly known as the sessile alsodeia, is a flowering plant native to the Mediterranean region. It is a member of the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its small, trifoliate leaves. The plant produces small, yellow flowers that are clustered in racemes, which bloom in the spring. Alsodeia sessilis is typically found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to dry, sunny environments. It is often used in ecological restoration projects due to its hardy nature and ability to stabilize soil.
